meanings.definition: Having a cavity, gap, or space within
meanings.sent1: The tree trunk was the hollowest part of the forest.
meanings.sent2: The old drum was the hollowest when struck.
meanings.sent3: The hollowest pumpkin won the contest for being the spookiest.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed in the hollowest corridors of the abandoned house.
meanings.sent5: The hollowest sound came from the empty cave, sending shivers down their spines.

meanings.definition: Lacking in real value or sincerity
meanings.sent1: His hollowest promises were never fulfilled.
meanings.sent2: The apology seemed hollowest when he couldn't look her in the eye.
meanings.sent3: The hollowest excuse he could come up with was blaming the dog for eating his homework.
meanings.sent4: The hollowest praise came from those who didn't truly mean it.
meanings.sent5: The hollowest smiles masked their true feelings of disappointment.

meanings.definition: To make or become hollow by removing the inner part
meanings.sent1: She hollowed out the pumpkin to make a jack-o'-lantern.
meanings.sent2: The woodpecker hollowedest the tree trunk for its nest.
meanings.sent3: He hollowest the log to create a makeshift drum.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor hollowest the marble block to reveal the statue within.
meanings.sent5: The wind hollowest the sand dunes, shaping them into unique patterns.
